Pre-Game Insights: India have a 6-2 win-loss record against Zimbabwe in T20I cricket.
Zimbabwe will play against India in the first T20I of the five-match series at the Harare Sports Club in Harare.
The hosts Zimbabwe last played a T20I nearly two months ago against Bangladesh during an away series, which they lost 1-4, leading to a number of changes in the squad.
The newly crowned T20 World Cup champions, India, will have none of their players from the title-winning squad in the first couple of T20Is.

The pitches at the Harare Sports Club are known to be quite decent for batting, but it also provides early assistance to the pacers, and spinners to come into play in the middle overs with some turn on offer as well.
The average first innings score of 156 runs in T20Is at this venue might not be enough for either India or Zimbabwe to defend in the first match of their upcoming series.
Sikandar Raza will be captaining the Zimbabwe cricket team which welcomes Antum Naqvi, the Belgium-born cricketer of Pakistani descent, in the squad for the first time.
Wesley Madhevere and Brandon Mavuta have returned to the Zimbabwe set-up after serving their drug suspension.
Tendai Chatara will be bringing his experience to the Zimbabwe team after being on the sidelines for some time.
Shubman Gill will be leading the Indian cricket team in the five-match T20I series which boasts all the star performers from the recently concluded IPL 2024 season.
Some of the players to watch out in the Indian set-up include Abhishek Sharma, Dhruv Jurel, Rinku Singh, Tushar Deshpande, and Harshit Rana.
